data.title: Breakfast
data.text: If you want to have breakfast and have a quick meeting at the same time with friends or conduct business this place provides the ambiance for it. They gave great pastries and all sorts of coffee for your indulgence. Service is great with friendly staff.

data.title: Mouth Watering Good
data.text: The lemon bars at Europane are sooo good.  Hard to just eat one.  These make a great and portable dessert for concertgoers. Can't wait to try some of the other cookies .

data.title: Nice menu, good location
data.text: If you're in downtown Pasadena and looking for a light lunch, you can't go wrong with European. We had a couple of salads, just right for a hot summer's day. Mine was greens with feta, pecans and cranberries -- fresh and tasty. Ginger beer was a perfect accompaniment. Finished off with a chocolate chip cookie, exactly the way I like it, a bit chewy.

data.title: Good Offerings. Poor Attitude.
data.text:
Since when is it okay to treat your customers like they're annoying you? To be fair, Europane is not the only place I've noticed such a disregard for common courtesy. But literally every time I give them "another chance", the staff at the counter give me the same cold, stone face and minimal attention. Specially the two tall guys, that my family and I privately started referring to as "Rude Boy One and Two". So why do I keep returning? Well, that's where the place earns it's stars. The food offerings are quite good. Unique and true to their name. But is that enough to keep me coming back when there are so many great alternatives? Right now, I'm leaning towards no. 
Hello ownership? Are you listening?

data.title: Quick and worth the visit
data.text: Went for breakfast on my first day at Pasadena. They take special care to listen to your choices and then make suggestions. The food was served real quick and it was good. Good place for a quick grab!

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: My mom and I got salads and honestly they were a bit dry and flavorless. However their saving grace is their pastries. I think the best aspect of this place is the relaxed ambiance.

data.title: OMG If I lived in Pasadena I would be there every day.
data.text: I went to the one near the Convention Center- not sure of the address. I got a beet salad that was out of this world and an ice coffee and a couple cookies to have later. I have a pic of the salad but there does not appear to be a place to put it on here. They have an outdoor eating/patio area. You order at the counter and they bring the food out to you. Really- i totally loved this place.

data.title: Very cool Euro Bakery!
data.text: Loved this place, really fresh food served with coffee that will make you ask for a refill. Super nice staff!

data.title: Must go back for more.
data.text: Stopped on the way through town due to reviews. Picked up a "breakfast muffin". A savory breadish type muffin with a soft boiled egg inside!  Yum!!  Can't wait to go back and try more.

data.title: great bakery in pasadena
data.text: Great bakery with good selection of coffee drinks, pastries and lunch items. Their english muffins are particularly good

data.title: Beautiful egg salad sandwich
data.text: I had the seared chicken sandwich on sourdough for lunch.  It was tasty and filling.  My colleague had the open faced egg salad sandwich and it a lot of eggs, beautiful and delicious.  If you love eggs, try it!

data.title: Best Mocha Latte
data.text: The mocha is grated into your cup.  The best!  Pamper yourself!  Not your run of the mill mocha from Starbucks.  You can definitely taste the difference.  Their famous egg sandwich is a belly buster and so delicious.

data.title: Best place in town for a sandwich.
data.text: I am not a sandwich person as a rule but this place knows how make exceptional taste treats.  Our favorite sandwich is chicken on cranberry walnut and the egg salad sandwich is amazing in presentation and taste. The 345 E Colorado location is larger and newer - very nice.  We prefer the first 950 E. Colorado location, a smaller old school neighborhood feel, with the exact same menu.  Parking can be a challenge in both locations.  950 has a parking lot entry on Mentor.

data.title: Nice bakery with a decent but not excessive variety of baked goods
data.text: We grabbed a few bakery items for later consumption. The bakery selection is not as extension as some bakeries, which is probably a good thing since freshness with too many items can be a challenge.  The items that we selected were very well made with high quality ingredients.  The prices were fairly reasonable considering the price and while the lines were pretty long, they moved quickly.  Service was very friendly and efficient.

data.title: Excellent Sandwich Deal
data.text: Went here for lunch during a conference. Great sandwiches, good coffee, perfectly reasonable price -- better quality than you'd expect. They're in it for the long haul. It's an order at the counter and pick your food up kind of place -- no waiters or other such complications. Seating is ample but not luxurious; kind of a fastfood ambiance without quite getting that casual.

data.title: Best sandwich I've ever had!
data.text:
I'm in Pasadena on business, and walked just down the block from work.  I ordered the Almond Chicken sandwich on sour dough and wow!

The bread was lightly toasted, the chicken was slightly breaded with almonds.  The sandwich was too big to pick up, so I ate it with a knife and fork.  Lettuce, tomato, provolone cheese, avocado, onions , pesto and mayo.

Bravo!

data.title: Great breakfast in Pasadena!
data.text: We stopped in for breakfast, pastries, and coffee while we were visiting Pasadena. While nothing was particularly amazing, the food and coffee overall were very good. All around a good experience. A definite recommend.

data.title: Two excellent breakfasts
data.text: This location was close to our hotel and we made the trip twice. Good food; good coffee/mocha and very friendly/fun/efficient staff. Good value for money also. The bacon breakfast wrap was excellent.

data.title: Not so "euro" but very nice
data.text:
Europane is not so "euro". European - and particularly Italian - bread is different. 
The sandwiches are full of condiments. The ingredients are fairly fresh, are of good quality but not great. The prices are too high respect to the quality.

data.title: Great pastry and coffee
data.text:
I like the coffee and tasty pastry a lot. The pastry is delicious but not very sweet.  Coffee is robust, fresh and blended right.  

The cafe is popular.  Even on a weekday morning, the cafe was full.  There was a big wood table in the lobby so we all enjoyed a happy coffee break with other coffee lovers.

The location of the coffee shop is super good.  In the shopping area and on the route of Rose Parade.

The floor was a little bit messy due to the heavy traffic.
